author: Special Correspondent
text:
Teachers from All India Federation of University College Teachers Organisations on Tuesday launched a series of protests against what they termed as inaction of the Ministry of Human Resources Development in implementing the recommendations of the Seventh Pay Commission.

As a first step, the teachers held a demonstration in front of all the universities in the State. In Chennai, they protested at the University of Madras demanding the University Grants Commission to implement the seventh pay commission recommendations.

“Usually they set up the committee as soon as the pay commission announces revision. This time the government has not constituted the committee yet,” said G. Ravindran, general secretary of the Madras University Teachers’ Association.

The teachers say despite repeated requests the government has made no effort to implement the UGC pay scale to guest lecturers.
title: Teachers demand implementation of pay commission
